data.name: EVO_REQ_TILE_ELEMENT

data.name: EVO_REQ_TRADE
data.comment: Evolution requirement: must be from another team

data.name: SIGN_TUTORIAL_1_1
data.value: Hold {0}, and press a key to use a move.\nYou must use at least one move on an enemy Pokémon if you want to gain EXP from it.

data.name: SIGN_TUTORIAL_1_2
data.value: All moves and Pokémon have a type, such as Fire, Water, or Grass. There's 18 in all!\nUse a move that has a type-advantage against the enemy to do more damage.

data.name: SIGN_TUTORIAL_1_3
data.value: Some Pokémon have two types that can cover each other's weaknesses.\nUse a move that has an advantage against both for exceptional damage!

data.name: SIGN_TUTORIAL_2_1
data.value: Physical moves use your Attack and the opponent's Defense, while Special moves use your Special Attack and the opponent's Special Defense.\nThese stats can be temporarily modified: boosted or lowered by up to 6 stages.

data.name: SIGN_TUTORIAL_2_2
data.value: With a higher Speed stat your attacks are more likely to hit, and foes are less likely to hit you.\nThese chances are also affected by temporary Accuracy and Evasion modifiers: boosted or lowered by up to 6 stages.\nJust remember: if you ever miss an attack, the next one is sure to hit!

data.name: SIGN_TUTORIAL_2_3
data.value: Movement Speed differs from the Speed stat! Normally you move once per turn, but being sped up can let you move more than once. If you're slowed down, you will skip a turn each time you move.\nAttack speed is unaffected by all this; your turn always ends if you attack, and you never skip turns if slowed. Movement Speed can be temporarily boosted or lowered by up to 3 stages.

data.name: SIGN_TUTORIAL_3_1
data.value: There are 5 major status ailments: Sleep, Poison, Paralysis, Burn, and Freeze.\nIf you're under the effects of one, you cannot be affected by the other.

data.name: SIGN_TUTORIAL_3_2
data.value: There are many minor status ailments, such as Confusion and Leech Seed.\nThey can all affect a target at the same time.\nCheck your team member's Statuses page if you've lost track of them.

data.name: SIGN_TUTORIAL_3_3
data.value: Every Pokémon has an ability, which can make it immune to certain status, inflict status on opponents when attacked, or provide other beneficial effects.\nCheck your team member's Info page to read about its ability.

data.name: SIGN_TUTORIAL_4_1
data.value: Within dungeons, you will find various traps scattered on the floor.\nThey can be triggered by stepping on them, or by targeting them with certain attacks.

data.name: SIGN_TUTORIAL_4_2
data.value: Use your {0} attack to reveal traps directly in front of you. Traps won't trigger this way, either.

data.name: SIGN_TUTORIAL_4_3
data.value: Most traps will affect anyone within their range, while some will only target the Pokémon that triggered it! Lead enemies into them while avoiding them yourself.

data.name: SIGN_TUTORIAL_5_1
data.value: Hold {0} to turn in place, and hold {1} to move diagonally.

data.name: SIGN_TUTORIAL_5_2
data.value: Press {0}+{1} to skip your turn. You can use this to wait and heal from natural HP regeneration.\nMovement and combat in dungeons is always turn-based. Enemies won't move until you do, so take your time to plan accordingly.

data.name: SIGN_TUTORIAL_5_3
data.value: Press {0},{1},{2} or {3} to switch the team leader. This can be done without taking any turns.

data.name: SIGN_TUTORIAL_5_4
data.value: Press {0} to switch on Team Mode. With this, you can control the entire team, turn-by-turn.

data.name: TALK_FULL_0001
data.value: Let's help each other do well!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0002
data.value: Let's take this challenge on nice and steady.

data.name: TALK_FULL_0003
data.value: It'd be nice if we found even one [item].

data.name: TALK_FULL_0004
data.value: We need to stay on the lookout for any [kind]!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0006
data.value: I'll back you up with my [move], [player]!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0008
data.value: Let's find lots of good stuff!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0011
data.value: I've got a good feeling that we're going to find treasure!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0020
data.value: I'm happy to be exploring with you, [player].

data.name: TALK_FULL_0021
data.value: I'll show you how I can be useful, [player]!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0022
data.value: Let's give this one our best, [player]!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0023
data.value: I'll assist you the best I can with my [move], [player].

data.name: TALK_FULL_0024
data.value: Let's try our very best to find one [item]!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0025
data.value: I do wonder what discoveries lie ahead of us this time!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0026
data.value: I suspect that [kind] will be tough to deal with.

data.name: TALK_FULL_0040
data.value: It's a bit scary, but I'll do my best to keep up, [player]!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0041
data.value: Please don't get us in too deep!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0042
data.value: We should leave if it gets too dangerous, right?

data.name: TALK_FULL_0046
data.value: I feel a little more secure being with you, [player]!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0047
data.value: I really hope we'll find at least one [item].

data.name: TALK_FULL_0049
data.value: I'm not fond of fighting. But for you...I'll do my best!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0060
data.value: You know, carelessness can be our own worst enemy...

data.name: TALK_FULL_0061
data.value: You know, we should always see with more than just our eyes...

data.name: TALK_FULL_0062
data.value: I will support you with my [move], [player].

data.name: TALK_FULL_0063
data.value: We should always look before we leap, don't you think?

data.name: TALK_FULL_0064
data.value: You can trust me to watch out for you, [player].

data.name: TALK_FULL_0065
data.value: If you study your enemy closely, you'll always know what to do...

data.name: TALK_FULL_0066
data.value: Part of a winning strategy is knowing when to withdraw, you know...

data.name: TALK_FULL_0080
data.value: Some wisdom, eh? Haste makes waste, but persistence always pays...

data.name: TALK_FULL_0081
data.value: Wisdom, eh? Fools rush in, but winners walk and wonder...

data.name: TALK_FULL_0082
data.value: Rest assured. My trusty move, [move], will help you, [player]...

data.name: TALK_FULL_0083
data.value: We will surely find ourselves one [item]...

data.name: TALK_FULL_0084
data.value: Keep your eyes open for any [kind]...

data.name: TALK_FULL_0085
data.value: I'll be sure to keep an eye out to the rear, [player]...

data.name: TALK_FULL_0086
data.value: I've done this many a time, but it never ceases to be fun...

data.name: TALK_FULL_0100
data.value: Anywhere you go, I will follow, [player]!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0101
data.value: Impossible? [myname] doesn't know the meaning of "impossible"!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0102
data.value: You will surely witness the power of my [move]!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0103
data.value: Bah! I hardly see those [kind] as worthy adversaries!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0104
data.value: Keep the goal in mind! Yes, I can envision us finding that [item]!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0141
data.value: Let me take on the hard stuff!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0142
data.value: Yeah! No one can stand up to a team as good as we are!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0145
data.value: Don't be surprised if my great [move] move saves the day.

data.name: TALK_FULL_0146
data.value: Oh, yeah! Exploring's great! Who could want anything more?

data.name: TALK_FULL_0147
data.value: Gotta admit that you're not too shabby yourself!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0160
data.value: Let's get the exploration in gear!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0161
data.value: This kind of exploring isn't so bad...once in a while!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0162
data.value: Now don't mistake me for the enemy, OK?

data.name: TALK_FULL_0163
data.value: It'd be awesome if we could get ourselves one [item]!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0181
data.value: Where next? I'll go anywhere with you, [player]!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0182
data.value: I'll devote my [move] to help you, [player]!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0184
data.value: Ooooh! I wonder what treasures we'll find? I'm so excited!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0201
data.value: Let's keep pushing on! C'mon! Time to show 'em how it's done!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0202
data.value: I'll thump anyone who gets in our way, you'd better believe it!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0203
data.value: I can just sense it! Somewhere! That [item]!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0204
data.value: You'd better guess again if you think that I'm leaving without our treasure!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0205
data.value: No one's better than I am with the [move] move!

data.name: TALK_FULL_0206
data.value: Er, what? What do you want?

data.name: TALK_FULL_0220
data.value: Say, I've meant to ask! Um... I hope I'm being helpful?

data.name: TALK_FULL_0221
data.value: I'll explore the very best I can!

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_1_1_TITLE
data.comment: All data values below this and including this string are all Halcyon additions. These particular strings are for the first tutorial dungeon The formatting for string names is: BEGINNER_LESSON_(lesson i.e. floor)_SIGN_(room number)_(Sign number)_(Title or body)

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_1_1_BODY
data.value: The trials ahead will teach you the basics of dungeon crawling. You'll need to apply what you learn to make it to the end, so pay attention! Be sure to read all the signs ahead! You can skip 'em if you’re already well-learned, but I strongly suggest you read them anyway! If you get stuck, you can use the green target tiles in each room to reset the floor. You can also ask Sensei Lotus to reset the floor. - Totor
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_1_2_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_1_2_BODY
data.value: Mystery dungeons consist of a series of floors. The goal of each floor is to find the stairs that will bring you to the next floor. A mystery dungeon's layout changes everytime you enter, so no two adventures are alike! The minimap will help you navigate each floor. It fills out as you explore a floor. The flashing dot is you, yellow dots are allies, red dots are enemies, and blue dots are items. Blue squares are the stairs! There are other types of icons too, so keep an eye out!
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_1_3_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_1_3_BODY
data.value: Press {0} to open up the menu. From here, you can view your team’s moves, status, items, and more. You can learn more about your moves, abilities, items, and more by reading the descriptions in the relevant menus. Make sure to familiarize yourself with your team's capabilities! The Others menu will allow you to view a log of recent actions, as well as change settings such as battle speed or game resolution... Whatever that means.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_1_4_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_1_4_BODY
data.value: Enemy Pokémon won’t move until you move, so take all the time you need to decide your next move. You can hold {0} to move faster. This will just make the turns you spend moving go faster, you can’t use it to outrun enemy Pokémon. You can press {1} + {2} to pass your turn and wait in place. Hold {3} + {4} to keep passing turns. You recover HP slowly while moving through a dungeon or by waiting in place.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_1_5_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_1_5_BODY
data.value: Reserved (any ideas on what to put here?)
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_2_1_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_2_1_BODY
data.value: Pokémon can have up to 4 moves. Moves have a number of different properties: Range - distance a move can hit from. Some moves will also move the user as well. Power - Helps determine how much damage a move deals. Accuracy - How likely a move is to hit. The Speed stat, as well as temporary Accuracy and Evasion modifiers, are also used to determine if a move hits.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_2_2_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_2_2_BODY
data.value: Type - Determines how effective a move is against an enemy. For example, Water moves are strong against Fire Pokémon. Damage Category - Physical, special, or status. Physical moves use Attack/Defense, special moves use Sp. Attack/Sp. Defense. Status moves don’t directly inflict damage, but have other effects instead such as inflicting status or lowering stats. Max PP - Power Points (PP) are the energy required to use a move. A move can't be used if it runs out of PP until its restored.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_2_3_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_2_3_BODY
data.value: Moves have a wide variety of effects; familiarize yourself with your attacks! They may work differently than you're used to… All Pokémon can use a basic attack that is independent of their moves. Press {0} to do a basic attack. To do a move, hold {1} then press a key to use the associated move. Try using some moves on the volunteer! You can also choose which moves allies are allowed to use in the Moves menu. Allies can only use moves with a checkmark.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_3_1_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_3_1_BODY
data.value: Defeating Pokémon will give you experience. Once you’ve gotten enough, you will level up! Leveling up increases your stats and may let you learn a new move. The higher your level, the less experience you get from lower leveled enemies, and vice versa.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_3_2_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_3_2_BODY
data.value: You will only get experience for defeating a foe if you used a move or an item on them. Basic attacks alone won't cut it! Some Pokémon give more experience than others. Caterpie, for example, gives little while Chansey gives a lot. See for yourself by defeating the volunteers here! Remember that experience and levels gained here won’t be kept once you leave.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_4_1_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_4_1_BODY
data.value: Walking around dungeons will slowly deplete your Belly, a measure of how hungry you are. Only the party leader will lose Belly naturally. If your Belly reaches 0, then you will lose HP every turn until you eat something. Apples and Gummis are best for filling your stomach. Berries will fill your Belly a little bit too. Certain foods will also temporarily increase your max Belly for the rest of an adventure.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_5_1_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_5_1_BODY
data.value: Every Pokémon has 6 stats. HP (Hit Points), Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed. Some Pokémon excel in certain stats and are weak in others. HP - A Pokémon's health. If its HP reaches 0, it faints and can no longer battle. Attack - The higher a Pokémon’s Attack, the more damage its physical attacks do. Defense - The higher a Pokémon’s Defense, the less damage physical attacks will do to it.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_5_2_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_5_2_BODY
data.value: Special Attack - The higher a Pokémon’s Sp. Attack, the more damage its special attacks will do. Special Defense - The higher a Pokémon’s Sp. Defense, the less damage special attacks will do to it. Speed - The higher a Pokémon’s speed, the better its accuracy and evasion.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_5_3_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_5_3_BODY
data.value: Besides HP, a Pokémon's stats can be temporarily raised or lowered. A stat can be modified by up to 6 stages. Stat changes are reset upon entering a new floor or when stepping on a Wonder Tile. There are some Wonder Tiles behind this sign. The volunteers in this room will demonstrate moves that modify stats!
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_5_4_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_5_4_BODY
data.value: Movement Speed is separate from the Speed stat. Increased Movement Speed allows you to move more than once per turn, while decreased Movement Speed causes you to skip a turn each time you move. Attack speed is unaffected by Movement Speed. Your turn ends if you attack even if sped up, and attacking won't skip turns if you're slowed. A Pokémon’s Movement Speed can be modified up to 3 times in either direction.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_5_5_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_5_5_BODY
data.value: In addition to the 6 stats, there are two additional, temporary stat modifiers: Accuracy and Evasion. These work in conjunction with the Speed stat to determine hit/dodge rate. By the way, a Pokémon can never miss an attack twice in a row. If you miss, the next attack will always hit!
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_6_1_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_6_1_BODY
data.value: Types are the elemental affiliation of a Pokémon or move. Certain types are strong or weak against other types. For example, Grass moves are ineffective against Fire Pokémon but are strong against Water Pokémon. Some types are completely ineffective against other types. For example, Normal moves can’t hit Ghost Pokémon. Basic attacks have no type and hit every Pokémon for regular damage.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_6_2_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_6_2_BODY
data.value: A Pokémon can consist of two types. A Pokémon’s second type can cover the weakness of its other type. For example, a Grass/Water Pokémon would take normal damage from a Fire type attack. On the other hand, a Pokémon would take even more damage if a move is super-effective on both of its types! By the way, if a Pokémon uses a move that’s the same as one of its types, the move will receive a power boost! This is known as Same Type Attack Bonus.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_7_1_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_7_1_BODY
data.value: All Pokémon have a special attribute known as an Ability. Abilities have special effects in battle that are different for each Ability. For example, some Abilities prevent a Pokémon from being afflicted by a major status while and some Abilities increase the power of moves of a certain type when the user is low on HP.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_7_2_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_7_2_BODY
data.value: A specific Pokémon can only have one ability, but some species of Pokémon can have two possible Abilities. The volunteers here are of the same species, but have different abilities. The north one has Sturdy which prevents it from being defeated in a single hit, while the south one has Rock Head, which prevents recoil damage from moves like Take Down.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_7_3_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_GENERAL_SIGN_7_3_BODY
data.value: Some Pokémon that are normally weak have abilities that make them strong and vice versa. Shedinja is a Pokémon with very little HP and poor stats, but its Wonder Guard ability prevents all non-super effective attacks from landing (basic attacks still work). Slaking is a Pokémon with very high overall stats, but its Truant ability prevents it from attacking twice in a row. Very few abilities actually work against the user though.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_STATUS_SIGN_1_1_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_STATUS_SIGN_1_1_BODY
data.value: Pokémon can become afflicted with statuses during adventures in many ways, but most commonly through moves. Some moves inflict a status condition outright, but some have a chance to status in addition to their regular effect. Status conditions can be broken into two categories, major and minor. A Pokémon can only have one major status condition at a time. You can see what statuses a teammate has by checking them in the Team menu.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_STATUS_SIGN_1_2_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_STATUS_SIGN_1_2_BODY
data.value: Poison: Deals damage every turn and prevents natural HP regeneration. Goes away after a little while, when cured, or when you go to the next floor. Poison and Steel-types are immune to Poison. Badly Poisoned: Same as Poison, but the damage increases each time you attack. Burn: Deals damage when the Pokémon attacks and cuts their Attack by one-third. Goes away when cured, when going to the next floor, or by stepping in water. Fire-types are immune to Burn.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_STATUS_SIGN_1_3_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_STATUS_SIGN_1_3_BODY
data.value: Paralysis: Prevents the Pokémon from doing anything every other turn. Will go away on its own after a while or when cured. Electric-type Pokémon are immune to Paralysis. Sleep: Sleeping Pokémon cannot do anything. The Pokémon will wake up after a few turns, when cured, or if attacked. Freeze: Frozen Pokémon cannot do anything and cannot be affected by attacks. The Pokémon will thaw after a few turns, when cured, or if hit by a Fire-type attack. Ice-type Pokémon are immune to Freeze.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_STATUS_SIGN_2_1_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_STATUS_SIGN_2_1_BODY
data.value: While a Pokémon can only have one major status at a time, a Pokémon can have any number of minor statuses on them at a time. Most minor statuses will go away on their own after a little while. Note that some last longer than others!
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_STATUS_SIGN_2_2_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_STATUS_SIGN_2_2_BODY
data.value: Some examples of minor statuses: Confusion: Confused Pokémon will sometimes turn slightly left or right of their intended direction when taking any action. Also causes moves to target any Pokémon, friend or foe, so beware! Immobilization: Immobilized Pokémon cannot move. Leech Seed: The seeder will drain some of the seeded Pokémon's HP periodically. Grass types can't be seeded.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_STATUS_SIGN_2_3_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_STATUS_SIGN_2_3_BODY
data.value: Some minor statuses are beneficial. These statuses are typically given by a Pokémon using a move for itself or its allies. These typically go away after a while or when you go to the next floor. Some examples: Magnet Rise: The Pokémon cannot be hit by Ground-type attacks. Protect: The Pokémon cannot be hit at all for a turn. Reflect: The Pokémon and its nearby allies take half the normal physical damage.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_ITEMS_SIGN_1_1_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_ITEMS_SIGN_1_1_BODY
data.value: Items have countless uses; properly utilizing them well is critical to your success as an adventurer. Apples and berries can be eaten to fill your Belly and restore HP, PP, or cure status. You can throw items into teammates to have them eat it! Some edibles such as seeds have other effects, such as warping the ingester to a random spot on the floor or causing them to fall asleep. If an effect is negative, be sure to toss at an enemy!
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_ITEMS_SIGN_2_1_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_ITEMS_SIGN_2_1_BODY
data.value:
Wands and orbs have many kinds of effects. Wands shoot a projectile that applies their effect to the first Pokémon hit. Orbs have a more variable range of effect, but can usually hit multiple targets. Some orbs have utility effects.
To progress, use the Cleanse Orb to clean the Blowback Wand. Then use the wand to blow the Snorlax away.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_ITEMS_SIGN_3_1_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_ITEMS_SIGN_3_1_BODY
data.value:
Items such as scarves and bands can be equipped. Equipped items provide bonuses like status immunity or stat boosts. Keep in mind that equipped items still take up a space in your Treasure Bag!
To pass this trial, equip the Band of Passage then continue on. Without the band, you won't be worthy to continue! Sensei Lotus doesn't need one as she is always worthy to pass!
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_ITEMS_SIGN_4_1_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_ITEMS_SIGN_4_1_BODY
data.value:
Some items, such as Gravelerock and Sticks, can be thrown at enemies to damage them. Gravelerock travel in an arc, while Sticks go straight forward. Reviver seeds are somewhat rare, but incredibly useful consumables that can revive a teammate when they are defeated!
To pass this trial, throw a stick at Dragonite to aggravate him. Use the reviver seeds to revive after his counterattack, then continue to the stairs via the blasted path!
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_TERRAIN_SIGN_1_1_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_TERRAIN_SIGN_1_1_BODY
data.value: Terrain consists of the different floor tiles that exist in dungeons. Besides regular ground, there are a few other terrain types: Walls - Impassable. Ghost-type Pokémon can walk through walls, but this depletes their Belly quickly! Walls can be broken by some moves and items, but some walls cannot be broken or passed through no matter what. Water - Water, Dragon, and Flying-type Pokémon can tread water. If a Pokémon is burned when entering water, it will be cured of its burn.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_TERRAIN_SIGN_1_2_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_TERRAIN_SIGN_1_2_BODY
data.value: Lava: Fire, Dragon, and Flying-type Pokémon can pass over lava. If a Pokémon isn’t immune to burns, it will be burned when crossing lava. Items dropped in lava will incinerate and be lost forever! Abyss - Holes in the ground, only Flying types can pass over the abyss. Items dropped in the abyss will fall and be lost forever! Swamp - Water, Dragon, and Flying-type Pokémon can tread swamps. If a Pokémon isn’t immune to poison, it will be poisoned when passing through swamps.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_TERRAIN_SIGN_1_3_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_TERRAIN_SIGN_1_3_BODY
data.value: By the way, you can also press {0} followed by a direction to face that direction. You can also hold {1} to only allow diagonal movement. Try using it to navigate this next section.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_TERRAIN_SIGN_2_1_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_TERRAIN_SIGN_2_1_BODY
data.value:
To control other members of your team, you can press {0} to activate Team Mode. In Team Mode, you control each of your party member’s actions for a given turn. This is useful for sticky situations requiring a coordinated effort.
Use Team Mode to control Sensei Lotus to grab the keys!
You can Team Mode off by pressing {1} again.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_RECRUITMENT_SIGN_1_1_TITLE
data.comment: Sign title in beginner lesson

data.name: BEGINNER_LESSON_RECRUITMENT_SIGN_1_1_BODY
data.value: Enemy Pokémon can be recruited to your team by throwing an Apricorn at them! Different colors of Apricorn are better for recruiting certain types of Pokémon, and work better if the Pokémon is low on health. You can't recruit Pokémon that are more than five levels higher than you. To leave, recruit the Diglett, then use Team Mode to have him use Rock Smash to break open the path to the stairs! As he is a volunteer, he won't be staying with you once you leave.
data.comment: Sign info in beginner lesson

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_LOVER_001
data.value: Please rescue the love of my life!\nWithout her sweet fragrance, I feel so lost!
data.comment: Mission Body - Lovers - Illumise and Volbeat

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_LOVER_002
data.value: Please, save my love! She's the positivity\nin my life! The plus to my minus!
data.comment: Mission Body - Lovers - Plusle and Minun

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_LOVER_003
data.value: My love rolled off and got lost in a dungeon!\nHe's soft and wooly, like me! Please, rescue him!
data.comment: Mission Body - Lovers - Wooloo and Mareep

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_LOVER_004
data.value: Our love for each other is so strong! We need\neach other! Please, rescue my sweetheart!
data.comment: Mission Body - Lovers - Luvdisc and Luvdisc

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_LOVER_005
data.value: He charged off and can't find his way back home!\nHe's really sweet at heart! Please save him!
data.comment: Mission Body - Lovers - Miltank and Tauros

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_LOVER_006
data.value: My beloved [color=#00FF00]Butterfree[color] has gone missing!\nI love her more than anything else! Save her!
data.comment: Mission Body - Lovers - Venomoth and Butterfree

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_LOVER_007
data.value: Please, rescue my beloved! We truly\nunderstand each other's fickleness! Please!
data.comment: Mission Body - Lovers - Persian and Liepard

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_LOVER_008
data.value: Please save my sweetheart!\nWe've been in love even when we were [color=#00FF00]Wurmple[color]! Help her!
data.comment: Mission Body - Lovers - Dustox and Beautifly

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_LOVER_009
data.value: We've been in love ever since we were both [color=#00FF00]Snorunt[color]!\nPlease, someone, help her!
data.comment: Mission Body - Lovers - Glalie and Froslass

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_LOVER_010
data.value: His antennae's patterns have enamored me so!\nPlease rescue him so we can be together again!
data.comment: Mission Body - Lovers - Ribombee and Masquerain

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_LOVER_011
data.value: Nobody else understands our prickly love!\nSomeone! Please, help him!
data.comment: Mission Body - Lovers - Maractus and Cacturne

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_LOVER_012
data.value: The way she lights up the ocean depths takes my\nbreath away! Please, you have to save my love!
data.comment: Mission Body - Lovers - Lanturn and Lumineon

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_LOVER_013
data.value: She's the only one that can quell the sandstorm\nin my heart! Please, rescue her, somebody!
data.comment: Mission Body - Lovers - Tyranitar and Altaria

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_LOVER_014
data.value: Nothing compares to her beauty! I miss her so much!\nPlease, rescue her from that terrible dungeon!
data.comment: Mission Body - Lovers - Gyarados and Milotic

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_LOVER_015
data.value: He's my knight in shining armor!\nPlease, save the love of my life!
data.comment: Mission Body - Lovers - Gardevoir and Gallade

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_CHILD_001
data.value: Please look for my baby! She doesn't even\nknow how to properly wag her fingers yet! Help!
data.comment: Mission Body - Parent Child - Clefable and Cleffa

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_CHILD_002
data.value: Please rescue my darling son!\nHe started bouncing and just couldn't stop! Please, help!
data.comment: Mission Body - Parent Child - Wigglytuff and Igglybuff

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_CHILD_003
data.value: Please save my son! He's just a baby!\nHe's even partially in his egg still!
data.comment: Mission Body - Parent Child - Togekiss and Togepi

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_CHILD_004
data.value: My sweet little girl has disappeared!\nYou'll know her by the cute bud on her head!
data.comment: Mission Body - Parent Child - Roserade and Budew

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_CHILD_005
data.value: My poor little [color=#00FF00]Chingling[color]! Please rescue him!\nIf you hear a high-pitched cry, that's him!
data.comment: Mission Body - Parent Child - Chimecho and Chingling

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_CHILD_006
data.value: My son's gone missing! He's a bit of a crybaby,\nso please help him before he gets hurt!
data.comment: Mission Body - Parent Child - Sudowoodo and Bonsly

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_CHILD_007
data.value: [color=#00FF00]Mime Jr.[color] got lost somewhere!\nHe's still learning how to mimic properly! Please, anybody, help!
data.comment: Mission Body - Parent Child - Mr. Mime and Mime Jr.

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_CHILD_008
data.value: My daughter wandered off somewhere!\nShe isn't good at gnawing yet! Please help her!
data.comment: Mission Body - Parent Child - Raticate and Rattata

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_CHILD_009
data.value: My poor daughter, she's stuck in a dungeon!\nShe's wearing the clothes I made for her! Please!
data.comment: Mission Body - Parent Child - Leavanny and Sewaddle

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_CHILD_010
data.value: My baby is lost in this dungeon! His apple\ncan't hold out forever! Please, somebody, help!
data.comment: Mission Body - Parent Child - Appletun and Applin

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_CHILD_011
data.value: Please find [color=#00FF00]Aron[color]!\nHe probably munched too much metal and can't move!
data.comment: Mission Body - Parent Child - Aggron and Aron

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_CHILD_012
data.value: I can't find my baby [color=#00FF00]Smoochum[color]! She may\nhave got lost while examining things with her lips!
data.comment: Mission Body - Parent Child - Jynx and Smoochum

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_CHILD_013
data.value: My daughter's gone missing! She likes fire\nand is hotheaded! Please look for her!
data.comment: Mission Body - Parent Child - Magmortar and Magby

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_CHILD_014
data.value: My son needs a rescue!\nHe may be reckless with his electricity, but he's a good kid at heart!
data.comment: Mission Body - Parent Child - Electivire and Elekid

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_CHILD_015
data.value: My sweet daughter... I can't find her! She's\nupbeat and cheerful! Someone, please help her!
data.comment: Mission Body - Parent Child - Tsareena and Bounsweet

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_CHILD_016
data.value: Please help my [color=#00FF00]Hatenna[color]! She was scared by\na strong emotion and ran off! Help her!
data.comment: Mission Body - Parent Child - Hatterene and Hatenna

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_CHILD_017
data.value: [color=#00FF00]Gothita[color] got separated from me! She was staring\nat something when we got split up! Please, help!
data.comment: Mission Body - Parent Child - Gothitelle and Gothita

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_CHILD_018
data.value: Our son is missing! He isn't a strong tunneler yet!\nSomebody, help him!
data.comment: Mission Body - Parent Child - Dugtrio and Diglett

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_CHILD_019
data.value: Please find [color=#00FF00]Larvitar[color]!\nHe loves to eat dirt so much! Save him!
data.comment: Mission Body - Parent Child - Tyranitar and Larvitar

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_CHILD_020
data.value: She got lost after jumping off a cliff! Her\nhard head should protect her, but I'm worried!
data.comment: Mission Body - Parent Child - Salamence and Bagon

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_CHILD_021
data.value: I lost track of her after she molted!\nPlease, somebody save my daughter!
data.comment: Mission Body - Parent Child - Dragonite and Dratini

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_CHILD_022
data.value: He's just a kid! He can't fly well yet!\nI hope his ultrasonic waves keep him safe until somebody can rescue him!
data.comment: Mission Body - Parent Child - Noivern and Noibat

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_CHILD_023
data.value: Save my darling son, he isn't very strong!\nHe's probably hiding somewhere shady and damp!
data.comment: Mission Body - Parent Child - Goodra and Goomy

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_FRIEND_001
data.value: My friend [color=#00FF00]Cherubi[color] has gone missing! We're pals\nbecause we both get mistaken for fruit! Help!
data.comment: Mission Body - Friends - Cherubi and Applin

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_FRIEND_002
data.value: Please find my friend!\nI can't evolve without him!
data.comment: Mission Body - Friends - Mantyke and Remoraid

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_FRIEND_003
data.value: [color=#00FF00]Feebas[color] has gone missing!\nShe understands what it's like to be weak! Help!
data.comment: Mission Body - Friends - Magikarp and Feebas

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_FRIEND_004
data.value: Please save my precious friend!\nRelaxing at the pond is impossible without him!
data.comment: Mission Body - Friends - Poliwag and Lotad

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_FRIEND_005
data.value: Honey doesn't taste the same without [color=#00FF00]Combee[color]!\nPlease, find her! She means so much to me!
data.comment: Mission Body - Friends - Teddiursa and Combee

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_FRIEND_006
data.value: My best friend is stuck! Our ability to see with\nultrasonic waves is what made us friends!
data.comment: Mission Body - Friends - Woobat and Zubat

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_FRIEND_007
data.value: My best friend's gone missing! We identify\nwith each other because we love garbage!
data.comment: Mission Body - Friends - Trubbish and Grimer

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_FRIEND_008
data.value: Who else will I spread spores around with?\nHe's my best friend, please rescue him!
data.comment: Mission Body - Friends - Shroomish and Paras

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_FRIEND_009
data.value: [color=#00FF00]Togepi[color] is in danger! We share\na love of eggs, please, someone, help!
data.comment: Mission Body - Friends - Chansey and Togepi

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_FRIEND_010
data.value: We relate because we both can't evolve...\nPlease, save him, he means the world to me...
data.comment: Mission Body - Friends - Salandit and Combee

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_FRIEND_011
data.value: We prefer different times of day, but we're good friends regardless!\nPlease, you must rescue them!
data.comment: Mission Body - Friends - Lunatone and Solrock

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_FRIEND_012
data.value: We share electricity with our cheek pouches!\nWithout her, I have nobody to share with! Help!
data.comment: Mission Body - Friends - Emolga and Pachirisu

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_FRIEND_013
data.value: Only my friend is able to treat my dizziness!\nI can't think straight without him around! Someone, help him!
data.comment: Mission Body - Friends - Spinda and Hypno

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_FRIEND_014
data.value: [color=#00FF00]Pelipper[color] and I both enjoy carrying things in our\nmouth. We're best friends! Please rescue her!
data.comment: Mission Body - Friends - Cramorant and Pelipper

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_FRIEND_015
data.value: Our sensitivity to magnetism made us\ngood buddies! Please help him out!
data.comment: Mission Body - Friends - Magnemite and Nosepass

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_FRIEND_016
data.value: I have a strong connection with my friend\nbecause of her bright personality! Please help!
data.comment: Mission Body - Friends - Dustox and Lampent

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_FRIEND_017
data.value: Without his wonderful music, I cannot dance!\nPlease, bring him home!
data.comment: Mission Body - Friends - Lilligant and Kricketune

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_FRIEND_018
data.value: My friend and I love to make loud, silly noises\ntogether! I'm lonely without him! Please, help!
data.comment: Mission Body - Friends - Wigglytuff and Exploud

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_FRIEND_019
data.value: Without my friend, I have no meaning!\nPlease, rescue her from that awful dungeon!
data.comment: Mission Body - Friends - Beedrill and Florges

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_FRIEND_020
data.value: We became pals over our love of digging. He must\nhave gotten lost in a tunnel! Please rescue him!
data.comment: Mission Body - Friends - Dunsparce and Dugtrio

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_FRIEND_021
data.value: My best friend and I love to ride the wind\ntogether. It's not the same without her... Sob...
data.comment: Mission Body - Friends - Whimsicott and Jumpluff

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_RIVAL_001
data.value: Please save my rival! We haven't settled\nwho can make the strongest odor yet!
data.comment: Mission Body - Rivals - Koffing and Stunky

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_RIVAL_002
data.value: [color=#00FF00]Corphish[color] and I haven't settled whose pincers has\nmore power! Our rivalry can't end yet! Help!
data.comment: Mission Body - Rivals - Krabby and Corphish

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_RIVAL_003
data.value: We like to see who can pull the best pranks!\nPlease rescue him so we can compete again!
data.comment: Mission Body - Rivals - Shuppet and Duskull

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_RIVAL_004
data.value: Please rescue [color=#00FF00]Spearow[color]! We still need to\nfigure out whose better at flying!
data.comment: Mission Body - Rivals - Pidgey and Spearow

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_RIVAL_005
data.value: We've been rivals for a very long time!\nIt can't just end like this! Please, help!
data.comment: Mission Body - Rivals - Kabuto and Omanyte

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_RIVAL_006
data.value: [color=#00FF00]Spinarak[color] and I compete to see who can spin the\nbest webs! Please, help! I need my rival back!
data.comment: Mission Body - Rivals - Joltik and Spinarak

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_RIVAL_007
data.value: [color=#00FF00]Makuhita[color] makes an excellent training partner!\nSomebody, anybody, please!
data.comment: Mission Body - Rivals - Tyrogue and Makuhita

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_RIVAL_008
data.value: He got lost somewhere! Who will I play with\nnow? Please save him!
data.comment: Mission Body - Rivals - Lillipup and Poochyena

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_RIVAL_009
data.value: My friend and rival has gone missing! We're\nrivals because we both have lots of energy!
data.comment: Mission Body - Rivals - Vigoroth and Primeape

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_RIVAL_010
data.value: We lock horns to see who is stronger. I can't\ndo that alone... I need my rival back!
data.comment: Mission Body - Rivals - Sawsbuck and Stantler

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_RIVAL_011
data.value: We're competing to see who grows up stronger!\nWho else could I do that with? Help my rival!
data.comment: Mission Body - Rivals - Jangmo-o and Axew

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_RIVAL_012
data.value: We detest each other, but we push each other\nto do better too! Please save my rival!
data.comment: Mission Body - Rivals - Mareanie and Corsola

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_RIVAL_013
data.value: [color=#00FF00]Pinsir[color] and I love to wrestle with our horns!\nPlease help, he's in a real pinch!
data.comment: Mission Body - Rivals - Heracross and Pinsir

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_RIVAL_014
data.value: He makes a great intellectual adversary!\nI have no one to match wits with without him!
data.comment: Mission Body - Rivals - Slowking and Slowbro

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_RIVAL_015
data.value: We still never settled who was strongest...\nPlease, save him so we can see who is better!
data.comment: Mission Body - Rivals - Magmortar and Electivire

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_RIVAL_016
data.value: We've been rivals since our ancestors' time.\nOur rivalry can't end like this!
data.comment: Mission Body - Rivals - Cradily and Armaldo

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_RIVAL_017
data.value: For eons, we've been rivals with each other.\nI'd hate for it to end! Please, somebody, help!
data.comment: Mission Body - Rivals - Bastiodon and Rampardos

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_RIVAL_018
data.value: Please help [color=#00FF00]Aerodactyl[color]!\nShe's an irreplacable rival! I miss her!
data.comment: Mission Body - Rivals - Archeops and Aerodactyl

data.name: MISSION_BODY_SPECIAL_RIVAL_019
data.value: Please rescue my rival! We haven't finished\nseeing who is the bravest! Please, please!
data.comment: Mission Body - Rivals - Swellow and Staraptor
